style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;color:#000000;">61.9%</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">&#160;of net revenue, respectively.&#160;</span></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:10px;padding-top:10px;text-align:justify;text-indent:30px;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">We expect revenue from customers outside of United States to continue to be an important part of our overall net revenue and an increasing focus for net revenue growth opportunities.</span></div><div><a id="s0E5706AFFD58553E9DC9F9AF7434E468"></a></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:10px;padding-top:10px;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;font-style:normal;font-weight:bold;text-decoration:none;">Gross Margin</span></div><div><a id="s116F5F20C7535FB7BDEB708A68227F4E"></a></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:10px;padding-top:10px;text-align:justify;text-indent:30px;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">Gross margin </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">increase</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">d by </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">2.4</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;"> percentage points during the </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">three months ended</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;"> </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">December&#160;28, 2019</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;"> from </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">58.0%</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;"> in the same period a year ago to </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">60.4%</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;"> in the current period. This </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">increase</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;"> was primarily driven by higher revenue volume and favorable product mix within our NE segment and better manufacturing absorption in our OSP segment. </span></div><div><br/></div><div style="text-align:center;"><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:10px;padding-top:10px;text-align:center;text-indent:0px;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">39</span></div></div><hr style="page-break-after:always"></hr><div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:10px;padding-top:10px;text-align:justify;text-indent:30px;font-size:10pt;"><a style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;" href="#sE24B06041F3F5946B625D4BFEFCC01F1"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">Table of Contents</span></a></div></div><div><br/></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:10px;padding-top:10px;text-align:justify;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">The increase was partially offset by gross margin reduction in our SE segment as discussed below in the Operating Segment Information section.</span></div><div><a id="s4FB0E732673C5861828A016F12D4FABA"></a></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:10px;padding-top:10px;text-align:justify;text-indent:30px;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">Gross margin </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">increase</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">d by </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">2.2</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;"> percentage points during the </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">six months ended</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;"> </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">December&#160;28, 2019</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;"> from </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">57.1%</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;"> in the same period a year ago to </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">59.3%</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;"> in the current period. This </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">increase</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;"> was primarily driven by higher revenue volume and favorable product mix within our NE segment and better manufacturing absorption in our OSP segment. This </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">increase</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;"> was partially offset by gross margin reduction in our SE segment as discussed below in the Operating Segment Information section. </span></div><div><a id="s6442B55D45E65973B1152CA0D0F353FB"></a></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:10px;padding-top:10px;text-align:justify;text-indent:30px;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">As discussed in more detail under &#8220;</span><span style="font-family:Arial;">Net Revenue</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">&#8221; above, we sell products in certain markets that are consolidating, undergoing product, architectural and business model transitions, have high customer concentrations, are highly competitive (increasingly due to Asia-Pacific-based competition), are price sensitive and/or are affected by customer seasonal and mix variant buying patterns. We expect these factors to continue to result in variability of our gross margin.</span></div><div><a id="s7F4E81DB18945C3DA4971A19479194A4"></a></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:10px;padding-top:10px;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;font-style:normal;font-weight:bold;text-decoration:none;">Research and Development</span></div><div><a id="s3344124A5C5F5698B7BDAD4BCFD26F8B"></a></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:10px;padding-top:10px;text-align:justify;text-indent:30px;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">R&amp;D expense </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">increase</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">d by </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">$4.4 million</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">, or </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">9.6%</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">, during the </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">three months ended</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;"> </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">December&#160;28, 2019</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;"> compared to the same period a year ago. This </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">increase</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;"> was primarily driven by targeted investments to support increased demand for our Wireless products. As a percentage of net revenue, R&amp;D </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">increase</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">d by </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">1.0</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;"> percentage points during the </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">three months ended</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;"> </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">December&#160;28, 2019</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;"> compared to the same period a year ago.</span></div><div><a id="s9B952F23C2E15E1C885857B16CAD11B2"></a></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:10px;padding-top:10px;text-align:justify;text-indent:30px;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">R&amp;D expense </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">increase</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">d by </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">$13.3 million</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">, or </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">15.0%</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">, during the </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">six months ended</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;"> </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">December&#160;28, 2019</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;"> compared to the same period a year ago. This </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">increase</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;"> was primarily driven by targeted investments to support increased demand for our key product lines and additional R&amp;D costs incurred from our acquired businesses. As a percentage of net revenue R&amp;D </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">increase</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">d by </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">1.2</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;"> percentage points during the </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">six months ended</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;"> </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">December&#160;28, 2019</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;"> compared to the same period a year ago.</span></div><div><a id="sA5CC879A18145B5DAB138E5C34D5CF82"></a></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:10px;padding-top:10px;text-align:justify;text-indent:30px;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">We believe that continuing our investments in R&amp;D is critical to attaining our strategic objectives. We plan to continue to invest in R&amp;D and new products that will further differentiate us in the marketplace.</span></div><div><a id="s63518576C33252B39EBF9198555B706F"></a></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:10px;padding-top:10px;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;font-style:normal;font-weight:bold;text-decoration:none;">Selling, General and Administrative</span></div><div><a id="sDC82717EB1CD5B95BA9D74466DA987F1"></a></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:10px;padding-top:10px;text-align:justify;text-indent:30px;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">SG&amp;A expense </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">decrease</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">d by </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">$2.2 million</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;"> or </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">2.5%</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">, during the </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">three months ended</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;"> </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">December&#160;28, 2019</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;"> compared to the same period a year ago. This </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">decrease</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;"> was primarily due to change in fair value of contingent consideration, partially offset by targeted investments including upgrading our ERP and related systems, 3D Sensing products and  additional SG&amp;A costs incurred from our acquired businesses. As a percentage of net revenue, SG&amp;A </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">decrease</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">d </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">1.3 percentage points</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;"> during the </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">three months ended</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;"> </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">December&#160;28, 2019</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;"> compared to the same period a year ago.</span></div><div><a id="s6390045D3F5B5283A954A8EA04ABF2B0"></a></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:10px;padding-top:10px;text-align:justify;text-indent:30px;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">SG&amp;A expense </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">increase</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">d by </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">$6.6 million</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">, or </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">3.8%</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">, during the </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">six months ended</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;"> </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">December&#160;28, 2019</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;"> compared to the same period a year ago. This </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">increase</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;"> is primarily due to ongoing investments including upgrading our ERP and related systems, targeted investments to support increased demand for our Wireless, Fiber and 3D Sensing products and additional SG&amp;A costs incurred from our acquired businesses. It is partially offset by the change in fair value of contingent consideration. As a percentage of net revenue, SG&amp;A </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">decrease</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">d </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">0.7</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;"> percentage points during the </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">six months ended</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;"> </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">December&#160;28, 2019</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;"> compared to the same period a year ago.</span></div><div><a id="s027C6585E1DA5D869AE88FA4A09E8C50"></a></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:10px;padding-top:10px;text-align:justify;text-indent:30px;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">We intend to continue to focus on reducing our SG&amp;A expense as a percentage of net revenue. However, we may experience in the future, certain charges unrelated to our core operating performance, such as mergers and acquisitions-related expenses, litigation expenses and charges from changes in the fair value measurement of our contingent consideration liabilities, which could increase our SG&amp;A expenses and potentially impact our profitability expectations in any particular quarter.</span></div><div><a id="s6237A15FC3675BACA71A49297D39C49F"></a></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:10px;padding-top:10px;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;font-style:normal;font-weight:bold;text-decoration:none;">Restructuring and Related Charges</span></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:0px;padding-top:0px;text-align:justify;text-indent:30px;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">From time to time we have initiated strategic restructuring events primarily intended to reduce costs, consolidate our operations, integrate various acquisitions, rationalize the manufacturing of our products and align our businesses to address market conditions. We estimate annualized gross cost savings of approximately </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">$24.3 million</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;"> excluding any one-time charges as a result of recent restructuring activities initiated in the last twelve months. Refer to &#8220;</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">Note 13. Restructuring and Related Charges</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">&#8221; for more information.</span></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:0px;padding-top:0px;text-align:justify;text-indent:30px;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;"><br/></span></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:0px;padding-top:0px;text-align:justify;text-indent:30px;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">As of </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">December&#160;28, 2019</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">, our total restructuring accrual was </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">$5.4 million</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">. During the </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">three and six months ended</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;"> </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">December&#160;28, 2019</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">, we recorded </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">$(0.9) million</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;"> and </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">$(0.6) million</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;"> respectively, in restructuring and related (benefits) </span></div><div><br/></div><div style="text-align:center;"><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:10px;padding-top:10px;text-align:center;text-indent:0px;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">40</span></div></div><hr style="page-break-after:always"></hr><div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:10px;padding-top:10px;text-align:justify;text-indent:30px;font-size:10pt;"><a style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;" href="#sE24B06041F3F5946B625D4BFEFCC01F1"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">Table of Contents</span></a></div></div><div><br/></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:0px;padding-top:0px;text-align:justify;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">charges. During the </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">three and six months ended</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;"> </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">December&#160;29, 2018</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">, we recorded </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">$0.3 million</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;"> and </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">$15.1 million</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;"> respectively, in restructuring and related (benefit) charges.</span></div><div><a id="s75AD6AEAA5A55FA3BAD8BB45DA553269"></a></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:10px;padding-top:10px;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;font-style:normal;font-weight:bold;text-decoration:none;">Interest and Other Income, Net</span></div><div><a id="sFDF14E414DBE52B88B6470C7B76CCCCA"></a></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:10px;padding-top:10px;text-align:justify;text-indent:30px;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">Interest and other income, net, was </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">$1.3 million</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;"> during the </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">three months ended</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;"> </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">December&#160;28, 2019</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;"> compared to </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">$1.5 million</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;"> the same period a year ago. This </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">$0.2 million</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;"> </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">decrease</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;"> was primarily driven by</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">$0.5 million</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;"> unfavorable foreign exchange impact as the balance sheet hedging program provided a less favorable offset to the remeasurement of underlying foreign exchange exposures during the current period, offset by </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">$0.4 million</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;"> more in interest income due to higher average investment balance during the current period. </span></div><div><a id="sAFBB73CAF1B45163B7C2D819C8058CCE"></a></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:10px;padding-top:10px;text-align:justify;text-indent:30px;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">Interest and other income, net, was </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">$4.0 million</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;"> during the </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">six months ended</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;"> </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">December&#160;28, 2019</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;"> compared to </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">$3.2 million</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;"> the same period a year ago. This </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">$0.8 million</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;"> </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">increase</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;"> was primarily driven by </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">$1.3 million</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;"> favorable foreign exchange impact as the balance sheet hedging program provided a more favorable offset to the remeasurement of underlying foreign exchange exposures during the current period, offset by a </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">$0.4 million</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;"> decrease in interest income during the current period due to much lower average investment balance during the current period. </span></div><div><a id="s705237766DBD5C97BB70827810743947"></a></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:10px;padding-top:10px;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;font-style:normal;font-weight:bold;text-decoration:none;">Interest Expense</span></div><div><a id="s8C14F383BF655A0BB1CC8F44246F1A89"></a></div><div </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">increase</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;color:#2c2c2c;">d by </span><span in debt discount accretion of the 2023 Notes and 2024 Notes during the current period.</span></div><div><a id="sDB5C0122923D5CCE92581228C832B99A"></a></div><div </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;color:#2c2c2c;">decrease</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;color:#2c2c2c;">d by </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;color:#2c2c2c;">8.2%</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;color:#2c2c2c;">, during the </span><span debt discount accretion of the 2033 Notes during the current period as the notes were fully redeemed or converted in the second quarter of fiscal 2019.</span></div><div><a id="s27C2922C270A55D68BB628EF9025F976"></a></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:10px;padding-top:10px;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;font-style:normal;font-weight:bold;text-decoration:none;">Provision for Income Taxes</span></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:10px;padding-top:10px;text-align:justify;text-indent:30px;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">We recorded an income tax expense of </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">$9.9 million</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;"> and&#160;</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">$18.2 million</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;"> for the </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">three and six months ended</span><span We recorded an income tax expense of </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">$10.9 million</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;"> and </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">$16.6 million</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;"> for the </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">three and six months ended</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;"> </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">December&#160;29, 2018</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">, respectively. </span></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:10px;padding-top:10px;text-align:justify;text-indent:30px;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">The income tax expense for the </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">three and six months ended</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;"> </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">December&#160;28, 2019</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;"> and </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">December&#160;29, 2018</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;"> primarily relates to income tax in certain foreign and state jurisdictions based on our forecasted pre-tax income or loss for the respective fiscal year. </span></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:10px;padding-top:10px;text-align:justify;text-indent:30px;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">The income tax expense recorded differs from the expected tax expense that would be calculated by applying the federal statutory rate to our income from continuing operations before taxes primarily due to the changes in valuation allowance for deferred tax assets attributable to our domestic and foreign income (loss) from continuing operations.</span></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:10px;padding-top:10px;text-align:justify;text-indent:30px;font-size:11pt;"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">As of </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">December&#160;28, 2019</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">, and </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">June&#160;29, 2019</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">, our unrecognized tax benefits totaled </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">$50.7 million</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;"> and </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">$50.9 million</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">, respectively, and are included in deferred taxes and other non-current tax liabilities, net. We had </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">$4.2 million</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;"> accrued for the payment of interest and penalties at </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">December&#160;28, 2019</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">. The timing and resolution of income tax examinations is uncertain, and the amounts ultimately paid, if any, upon resolution of issues raised by the taxing authorities may differ from the amounts accrued for each year. Although we do not expect that our balance of gross unrecognized tax benefits will change materially in the next 12 months, given the uncertainty in the development of ongoing income tax examinations, we are unable to estimate the full range of possible adjustments to this balance.</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;">&#160;</span></div><div><br/></div><div style="text-align:center;"><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:10px;padding-top:10px;text-align:center;text-indent:0px;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">41</span></div></div><hr style="page-break-after:always"></hr><div><a id="s9D522D4B88725080B178C9654B27F6AB"></a></div><div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:10px;padding-top:10px;text-align:justify;text-indent:30px;font-size:10pt;"><a style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;" 2019</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">, NE gross margin </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">increase</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">d by </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">2.1</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;"> percentage points from </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">64.3%</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;"> in the same period a year ago to </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">66.4%</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;"> in the current period. This </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">increase</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;"> was primarily due to higher revenue volume and gross margin improvement from favorable product mix.</span></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:10px;padding-top:10px;text-align:justify;text-indent:30px;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">During the </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">six months ended</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;"> </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">December&#160;28, 2019</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">, NE gross margin </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">increase</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">d by </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">1.9</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;"> percentage points from </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">63.5%</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;"> in the same period a year ago to </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">65.4%</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;"> in the current period. This </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">increase</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;"> was primarily due to higher revenue volume and gross margin improvement from favorable product mix.</span></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:10px;padding-top:10px;text-align:justify;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;color:#000000;font-style:normal;font-weight:normal;text-decoration:underline;">Service Enablement</span></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:10px;padding-top:10px;text-align:justify;text-indent:30px;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">During the </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">three months ended</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;"> </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">December&#160;28, 2019</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">, SE gross margin </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">decrease</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">d by </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">5.3</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;"> percentage points from </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">72.0%</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;"> in the same period a year ago to </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">66.7%</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;"> in the current period. This decrease was primarily due to unfavorable product mix and under absorption of fixed costs.</span></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:10px;padding-top:10px;text-align:justify;text-indent:30px;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">During the </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">six months ended</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;"> </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">December&#160;28, 2019</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">, SE gross margin </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">decrease</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">d by </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">6.9</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;"> percentage points from </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">71.0%</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;"> in the same period a year ago to </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">64.1%</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;"> in the current period. This decrease was primarily due to lower revenue volume and unfavorable product mix.</span></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:10px;padding-top:10px;text-align:justify;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;color:#000000;font-style:normal;font-weight:normal;text-decoration:underline;">Network and Service Enablement (&#8220;NSE&#8221;)</span></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:10px;padding-top:10px;text-align:justify;text-indent:30px;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">During the </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">three months ended</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;"> </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">December&#160;28, 2019</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">, NSE operating margin </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">increase</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">d by </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">1.3</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;"> percentage points from </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">14.7%</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;"> in the same period a year ago to </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">16.0%</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;"> in the current period. This </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">increase</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;"> in operating margin was primarily driven by higher gross margins as discussed above, partially offset by targeted investments to support our growth initiatives for our Wireless products.</span></div><div><br/></div><div style="text-align:center;"><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:10px;padding-top:10px;text-align:center;text-indent:0px;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">42</span></div></div><hr style="page-break-after:always"></hr><div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:10px;padding-top:10px;text-align:justify;text-indent:30px;font-size:10pt;"><a style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;" href="#sE24B06041F3F5946B625D4BFEFCC01F1"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">Table of Contents</span></a></div></div><div><br/></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:10px;padding-top:10px;text-align:justify;text-indent:30px;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">During the </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">six months ended</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;"> </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">December&#160;28, 2019</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">, NSE operating margin </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">increase</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">d by </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">1.3</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;"> percentage points from </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">11.9%</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;"> in the same period a year ago to </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">13.2%</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;"> in the current period. This </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">increase</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;"> in operating margin was primarily driven by increase in gross margin as discussed above, partially offset by targeted investments to support our growth initiatives for our Wireless products.</span></div><div><a id="s2C6A43B02C62504EBFF2302C5A4700F2"></a></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:10px;padding-top:10px;text-align:justify;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;color:#000000;font-style:normal;font-weight:normal;text-decoration:underline;">Optical Security and Performance Products</span></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:10px;padding-top:10px;text-align:justify;text-indent:30px;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">During the </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">three months ended</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;"> </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">December&#160;28, 2019</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;"> OSP gross margin </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">increase</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">d by </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">4.6</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;"> percentage points from </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">50.2%</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;"> in the same period a year ago to </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">54.8%</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;"> in the current period. This </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">increase</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;"> was primarily due to gross margin improvement in our Consumer and Industrial products, favorable manufacturing overhead absorption, partially offset by unfavorable product mix due to lower revenue from Anti-Counterfeiting products.</span></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:10px;padding-top:10px;text-align:justify;text-indent:30px;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">During the </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">six months ended</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;"> </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">December&#160;28, 2019</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">, OSP gross margin </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">increase</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">d by </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">4.1</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;"> percentage points from </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">50.4%</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;"> in the same period a year ago to </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">54.5%</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;"> in the current period. This increase was primarily due to gross margin improvement in our Consumer and Industrial products, favorable manufacturing overhead absorption, partially offset by unfavorable product mix due to lower revenue from Anti-Counterfeiting products.</span></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:10px;padding-top:10px;text-align:justify;text-indent:30px;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">OSP operating margin </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">increase</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">d by </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">0.8</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;"> percentage points during the </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">three months ended</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;"> </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">December&#160;28, 2019</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;"> from </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">37.4%</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;"> in the same period a year ago to </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">38.2%</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;"> in the current period. The </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">increase</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;"> in operating margin was primarily due to higher gross margins as discussed above, offset by increased 3D Sensing investments.</span></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:10px;padding-top:10px;text-align:justify;text-indent:30px;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">OSP operating margin </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">increase</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">d by </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">1.8</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;"> percentage points during the </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">six months ended</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;"> </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">December&#160;28, 2019</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;"> from </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">36.3%</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;"> in the same period a year ago to </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">38.1%</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;"> in the current period. The </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">increase</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;"> in operating margin was primarily due to higher gross margins as discussed above, offset by increased 3D Sensing investments.</span></div><div><a id="s758060A57EC4528A82DEF97D8748A730"></a></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:10px;padding-top:10px;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;font-style:normal;font-weight:bold;text-decoration:none;">Liquidity and Capital Resources</span></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:0px;padding-top:0px;text-align:justify;text-indent:30px;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">Our cash investments are made in accordance with an investment policy approved by the Audit Committee of our Board of Directors and has not changed from that disclosed in our 10-K. As of </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">December&#160;28, 2019</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">, U.S. entities owned approximately </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">26.3%</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;"> of our cash and cash equivalents, short-term investments and restricted cash.</span></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:10px;padding-top:10px;text-align:justify;text-indent:30px;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">As of </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">December&#160;28, 2019</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">, the majority of our cash investments have maturities of 90 days or less and are of high credit quality. Although we intend to hold these investments to maturity, in the event that we are required to sell any of these securities under adverse market conditions, losses could be recognized on such sales. During the </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">three months ended</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;"> </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">December&#160;28, 2019</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">, we have not realized material investment losses but can provide no assurance that the value or the liquidity of our investments will not be impacted by adverse conditions in the financial markets. In addition, we maintain cash balances in operating accounts that are with third party financial institutions. These balances in the U.S. may exceed the Federal Deposit Insurance Corporation (&#8220;FDIC&#8221;) insurance limits. While we monitor the cash balances in our operating accounts and adjust the cash balances as appropriate, these cash balances could be impacted if the underlying financial institutions fail.</span></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:10px;padding-top:10px;text-align:justify;text-indent:30px;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">On August 15, 2018, certain holders of the 2033 Notes issued in August 2013 exercised the put option and an aggregate principal amount of </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">$134.3 million</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;"> of the 2033 Notes was validly surrendered for repurchase. The Company accepted all such notes for payment with available cash. On September 5, 2018, the Company elected to exercise its optional redemption right to redeem all </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">$142.7 million</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;"> aggregate principal amount of its outstanding 2033 Notes. The date fixed for the redemption of the Notes was </span><span style="font-family:Arial;">October&#160;10, 2018</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;"> (Redemption Date). In connection with the redemption, holders of </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">$112.0 million</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;"> aggregate principal amount of Notes converted their Notes in accordance with the terms and conditions of the Notes. Note holders who converted their notes received an aggregate payout of </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">$111.8 million</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;"> in cash and were issued </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">231,795</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;"> shares of the Company&#8217;s common stock. The Company redeemed the remaining </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">$30.7 million</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;"> aggregate principal amount of outstanding Notes in accordance with its notice of redemption dated September 5, 2018. The Company paid to the registered holders of the Notes that were redeemed an aggregate amount of approximately </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">$30.8 million</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">, including accrued and unpaid interest up to, but excluding, the Redemption Date. As of </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">December&#160;28, 2019</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">, none of the 2033 Notes remain outstanding. For additional information related to our debt refer to &#8220;</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">Note 11. Debt</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">.&#8221;</span></div><div><a id="sD77A1F3B23C05545AD5A28725F4BAF20"></a></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:10px;padding-top:10px;text-align:justify;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;color:#000000;font-style:normal;font-weight:normal;text-decoration:underline;">Six Months Ended</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;color:#000000;font-style:normal;font-weight:normal;text-decoration:underline;"> </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;color:#000000;font-style:normal;font-weight:normal;text-decoration:underline;">December&#160;28, 2019</span></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:10px;padding-top:10px;text-align:justify;text-indent:30px;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">As of </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">December&#160;28, 2019</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">, our combined balance of cash and cash equivalents, short-term investments, and restricted cash increased by </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">$30.4 million</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;"> to </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">$556.9 million</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;"> from </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">$526.5 million</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;"> as of </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">June&#160;29, 2019</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">.</span></div><div><br/></div><div style="text-align:center;"><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:10px;padding-top:10px;text-align:center;text-indent:0px;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">43</span></div></div><hr style="page-break-after:always"></hr><div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:10px;padding-top:10px;text-align:justify;text-indent:30px;font-size:10pt;"><a style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;" href="#sE24B06041F3F5946B625D4BFEFCC01F1"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">Table of Contents</span></a></div></div><div><br/></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:10px;padding-top:10px;text-align:justify;text-indent:30px;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">During the </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">six months ended</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;"> </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">December&#160;28, 2019</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">, </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">Cash provided by</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;"> operating activities was </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">$69.3 million</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">, consisting of net income of </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">$34.8 million</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;"> adjusted for non-cash charges (e.g.,&#160;depreciation, amortization, stock-based compensation and change in fair value of contingent liabilities) which totaled $</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">81.9 million</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">, including changes in deferred tax balances, and changes in operating assets and liabilities that used </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">$47.4 million</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">. Changes in our operating assets and liabilities related primarily to an increase in accounts receivable of </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">$13.5 million</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;"> mainly driven by revenue growth,  a decrease in accounts payable of </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">$14.2 million</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;"> primarily driven by timing of purchases and related payments, a decrease in accrued expenses and other current and non-current liabilities of </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">$37.3 million</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">, and an increase in other current and non-current assets of </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">$2.5 million</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">. These changes were partially offset by an increase in accrued payroll and related expenses of </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">$8.2 million</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">, an increase in income taxes payable of </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">$5.8 million</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">, a decrease in inventories of </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">$3.2 million</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;"> due to higher shipment volume at the end of the quarter, and an increase in deferred revenue of </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">$2.9 million</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">.</span></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:10px;padding-top:10px;text-align:justify;text-indent:30px;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">During the </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">six months ended</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;"> </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">December&#160;28, 2019</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">, </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">Cash used in</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;"> investing activities was </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">$10.7 million</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">, primarily related to </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">$13.3 million</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;"> of cash used for capital expenditures, offset by </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">$3.1 million</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;"> proceeds from sales of assets.</span></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:10px;padding-top:10px;text-align:justify;text-indent:30px;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">During the </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">six months ended</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;"> </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">December&#160;28, 2019</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">, </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">Cash used in</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;"> financing activities was </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">$25.3 million</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">, primarily resulting from&#160;</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">$15.1 million</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;"> in withholding tax payments on the vesting of restricted stock awards, </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">$10.7 million</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;"> in cash paid to repurchase common stock under our share repurchase program and </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">$1.8 million</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;"> payments on financing obligations; offset by </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">$2.3 million</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">&#160;in proceeds from the exercise of stock options and the issuance of common stock under our employee stock purchase plan.</span></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:10px;padding-top:10px;text-align:justify;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;color:#000000;font-style:normal;font-weight:normal;text-decoration:underline;">Six Months Ended</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;color:#000000;font-style:normal;font-weight:normal;text-decoration:underline;"> </span><span style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:10px;padding-top:10px;text-align:justify;text-indent:30px;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">As of </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">December&#160;29, 2018</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">, our combined balance of cash and cash equivalents, short-term investments, and restricted cash decreased by </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">$285.5 million</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;"> to </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">$508.1 million</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;"> from </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">$793.6 million</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;"> as of </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">June&#160;30, 2018</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">.</span></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:10px;padding-top:10px;text-align:justify;text-indent:30px;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">During the </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">six months ended</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;"> </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">December&#160;29, 2018</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">, </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">Cash provided by</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;"> operating activities was </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">$69.1 million</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">, consisting of net loss of </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">$2.3 million</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;"> adjusted for non-cash charges (e.g.,&#160;depreciation, amortization and stock-based compensation) which totaled </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">$85.2 million</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">, including changes in deferred tax balance, and changes in operating assets and liabilities that provided </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">$13.8 million</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">. Changes in our operating assets and liabilities related primarily to an increase in accrued payroll and related expenses of&#160;</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">$9.5 million</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">, a decrease in inventories of </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">$3.4 million</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;"> due to increased shipments of 3D Sensing products, an increase in income taxes payable of&#160;</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">$7.0 million</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">, an increase in deferred revenue of </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">$0.3 million</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">, and an increase in accrued expenses and other current and non-current liabilities of </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">$3.2 million</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">. These changes were partially offset by an increase in accounts receivable of </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">$33.5 million</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;"> due to higher billings, a decrease in accounts payable of&#160;</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">$3.0 million</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">&#160;driven by the timing of payments, and an increase in other current and non-current assets of&#160;</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">$0.7 million</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">.</span></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:10px;padding-top:10px;text-align:justify;text-indent:30px;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">During the&#160;</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">six months ended</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">&#160;</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">December&#160;29, 2018</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">,&#160;</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">Cash provided by</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">&#160;investing activities was&#160;</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">$89.9 million</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">, primarily related to </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">$139.2 million</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;"> in sales and maturities of available-for-sale debt securities and </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">$3.0 million</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;"> proceeds from sales of assets; offset by </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">$24.2 million</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;"> of cash used for capital expenditures and&#160;</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">$28.1 million</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">&#160;used for acquisitions of businesses, net of cash acquired. </span></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:10px;padding-top:10px;text-align:justify;text-indent:30px;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">During the&#160;</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">six months ended</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">&#160;</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">December&#160;29, 2018</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">,&#160;</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">Cash used in</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">&#160;financing activities was&#160;</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">$294.0 million</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">, primarily resulting from&#160;</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">$276.9 million</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;"> used for redemption and conversion of our 2033 Notes, </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">$9.8 million</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;"> in withholding tax payments on vesting of restricted stock awards and </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">$0.9 million</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;"> in payment of financing obligations; offset by&#160;</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">$2.1 million</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">&#160;in proceeds from the exercise of stock options and the issuance of common stock under our employee stock purchase plan.</span></div><div><a id="sB61FEA90417D5635B3B9395273FB99E8"></a></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:10px;padding-top:10px;text-align:justify;text-indent:30px;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">We believe that our existing cash balances and investments will be sufficient to meet our liquidity and capital spending requirements over the next twelve months.
