style="line-height:120%;text-align:justify;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">compliance with covenants and other terms and conditions related to our financing arrangements.</span></div></td></tr></table><div><a id="sD14A4D0FA3C85E0CA66713357E8AF988"></a></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:10px;padding-top:10px;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;font-style:normal;font-weight:bold;text-decoration:none;">Contractual Obligations</span></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:10px;padding-top:10px;text-align:justify;text-indent:30px;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">There were </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">no</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;"> material changes to our existing contractual commitments during the </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">second</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;"> quarter of fiscal </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">2020</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">.</span></div><div><a id="s953A1A6F2F415E2FA2D08FAB78F20862"></a></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:10px;padding-top:10px;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;font-style:normal;font-weight:bold;text-decoration:none;">Off-Balance Sheet Arrangements</span></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:10px;padding-top:10px;text-align:justify;text-indent:30px;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">We do not have any off-balance sheet arrangements, as such term is defined in rules promulgated by the SEC, that have or are reasonably likely to have a current or future effect on our financial condition, changes in financial condition, revenues or expenses, results of operations, liquidity, capital expenditures or capital resources that are material to investors, </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">other than the guarantees discussed in &#8220;</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;color:#000000;">Note 18. Commitments and Contingencies</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">.&#8221;</span></div><div><a id="sFB154AB849A658D2AB5863D643D20F65"></a></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:10px;padding-top:10px;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;font-style:normal;font-weight:bold;text-decoration:none;">Employee Equity Incentive Plan</span></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:10px;padding-top:10px;text-align:justify;text-indent:30px;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">Our stock-based benefit plans are a broad-based, long-term retention program that is intended to attract and retain employees and align stockholder and employee interests. Refer to &#8220;</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;color:#000000;">Note 16. Stock-Based Compensation</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">&#8221; for more details.</span></div><div><a id="sB487ACA7FDAD53F992A75AF73A8CDCB8"></a></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:10px;padding-top:10px;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;font-style:normal;font-weight:bold;text-decoration:none;">Pension and Other Post-retirement Benefits</span></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:10px;padding-top:10px;text-align:justify;text-indent:30px;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">We sponsor significant pension plans for certain past and present employees in the United Kingdom (&#8220;U.K.&#8221;) and Germany. We are also responsible for the non-pension post-retirement benefit obligation (&#8220;PBO&#8221;) assumed from a past acquisition. All of these plans have been closed to new participants and no additional service costs are being accrued, except for certain plans in Germany assumed in connection with an acquisition in fiscal 2010. The U.K. plan is partially funded, and the other Germany plans, which were initially established as &#8220;pay-as-you-go&#8221; plans, are unfunded. As of </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">December&#160;28, 2019</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">, our pension plans were under funded by </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">$107.0</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">&#160;million since the PBO exceeded the fair value of plan assets. Similarly, we had a liability of </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">$0.4</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;"> million related to our non-pension post-retirement benefit plan. Pension plan assets are managed by external third parties and we monitor the performance of our investment managers. As of&#160;</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">December&#160;28, 2019</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">, the fair value of plan assets had increased approximately </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">3.0%</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;"> since </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">June&#160;29, 2019</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">, our most recent fiscal year end.</span></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:10px;padding-top:10px;text-align:justify;text-indent:30px;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">A key actuarial assumption in calculating the net periodic cost and the PBO is the discount rate. Changes in the discount rate impact the interest cost component of the net periodic benefit cost calculation and PBO due to the fact that the PBO is calculated on a net present value basis. Decreases in the discount rate will generally increase pre-tax cost, recognized expense and the PBO. Increases in the discount rate tend to have the opposite effect. We estimate a 50 basis point decrease or increase in the discount rate would cause a corresponding increase or decrease, respectively, in the PBO of approximately </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">$9.2 million</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;"> based upon data as of </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">June&#160;29, 2019</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">.</span></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:10px;padding-top:10px;text-align:justify;text-indent:30px;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">In estimating the expected return on plan assets, we consider historical returns on plan assets, adjusted for forward-looking considerations, inflation assumptions and the impact of active management of the plan&#8217;s invested assets. While it is not possible to accurately predict future rate movements, we believe our current assumptions are appropriate. Refer to &#8220;</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;color:#000000;">Note 17. Employee Pension and Other Benefit Plans</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">&#8221; for more details.</span></div><div><a id="s0CD0737C9EC0554AB90CCF34BAC9F775"></a></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:10px;padding-top:10px;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;font-style:normal;font-weight:bold;text-decoration:none;">Item&#160;3. Quantitative and Qualitative Disclosure About Market Risks</span></div><div><br/></div><div style="text-align:center;"><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:10px;padding-top:10px;text-align:center;text-indent:0px;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">45</span></div></div><hr style="page-break-after:always"></hr><div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:10px;padding-top:10px;text-align:justify;text-indent:30px;font-size:10pt;"><a style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;" href="#sE24B06041F3F5946B625D4BFEFCC01F1"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">Table of Contents</span></a></div></div><div><br/></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:0px;padding-top:0px;text-align:justify;text-indent:30px;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">The Company&#8217;s market risk has not changed materially from the foreign exchange and interest rate risks disclosed in Item 7A of the Company&#8217;s Annual Report on Form 10-K for the fiscal year ended </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">June&#160;29, 2019</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">.</span></div><div><a id="sC254942C2C055BA3A3C408D55A2D25D0"></a></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:10px;padding-top:10px;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;font-style:normal;font-weight:bold;text-decoration:none;">Item&#160;4. Controls and Procedures </span></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:10px;padding-top:10px;text-align:justify;text-indent:30px;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;font-weight:bold;">Evaluation of Disclosure Controls and Procedures</span></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:6px;padding-top:6px;text-align:justify;text-indent:30px;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">We maintain disclosure controls and procedures (as defined in Rules 13a-15(e) and 15d-15(e) under the Securities Exchange Act of 1934, as amended, or the Exchange Act), which are designed to ensure that information required to be disclosed in the reports we file or submit under the Exchange Act is recorded, processed, summarized and reported within the time periods&#160;specified in the Securities and Exchange Commission&#8217;s rules and forms, and that such information is accumulated and communicated to our management, including our Chief Executive Officer (CEO) and Chief Financial Officer (CFO), as appropriate to allow timely decisions regarding required disclosure. Our management, with the participation of our CEO and CFO, evaluated the effectiveness of the design and operation of our disclosure controls and procedures as of the end of the period covered by this Quarterly Report on Form&#160;10-Q. Based on that evaluation, our CEO and CFO concluded that our disclosure controls and procedures were effective as of </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">December&#160;28, 2019</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">.</span></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:10px;padding-top:10px;text-align:justify;text-indent:30px;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;font-weight:bold;">Changes in Internal Control Over Financial Reporting</span></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:10px;padding-top:10px;text-align:justify;text-indent:30px;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">There have been no changes in the Company&#8217;s internal control over financial reporting (as such term is defined in Rules&#160;13a-15(f)&#160;and 15d-15(f)&#160;under the Exchange Act) during the most recent fiscal quarter that have materially affected, or are reasonably likely to materially affect, the Company&#8217;s internal control over financial reporting.</span></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:10px;padding-top:10px;text-align:justify;text-indent:30px;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;font-weight:bold;">Limitations on Effectiveness of Controls</span></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:10px;padding-top:10px;text-align:justify;text-indent:30px;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">Our management, including our CEO and CFO, does not expect that our disclosure controls and procedures of our internal controls will prevent all errors and all fraud. A control system, no matter how well conceived and operated, can provide only reasonable, not absolute, assurance that the objectives of the control systems will be achieved. No evaluation of controls can provide absolute assurance that all control issues and instances of fraud, if any, within our company have been detected. Accordingly, our disclosure controls and procedures provide reasonable assurance of achieving their objective.</span></div><div><br/></div><div style="text-align:center;"><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:10px;padding-top:10px;text-align:center;text-indent:0px;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">46</span></div></div><hr style="page-break-after:always"></hr><div><a id="s254C19977D8B5FC3BC903AC8A0EF344F"></a></div><div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:10px;padding-top:10px;text-align:justify;text-indent:30px;font-size:10pt;"><a style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;" href="#sE24B06041F3F5946B625D4BFEFCC01F1"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">Table of Contents</span></a></div></div><div><br/></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:10px;padding-top:10px;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;font-style:normal;font-weight:bold;text-decoration:none;">PART&#160;II&#8212;OTHER INFORMATION</span></div><div><a id="s1C7A7CAB791C54E3BEB4F3D1FF88F5A2"></a></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:10px;padding-top:10px;font-size:10pt;"><a style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;color:#000000;font-style:normal;font-weight:bold;text-decoration:none;" href="#s254C19977D8B5FC3BC903AC8A0EF344F"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;color:#000000;font-style:normal;font-weight:bold;text-decoration:none;">Item&#160;1. Legal Proceedings</span></a></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:10px;padding-top:10px;text-align:justify;text-indent:30px;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">We are subject to a variety of claims and suits that arise from time to time in the ordinary course of our business. While management currently believes that resolving claims against us, individually or in aggregate, will not have a material adverse impact on our financial position, results of operations or statement of cash flows, these matters are subject to inherent uncertainties and management&#8217;s view of these matters may change in the future. If an unfavorable final outcome were to occur, it may have a material adverse impact on our financial position, results of operations or cash flows for the period in which the effect becomes reasonably estimable.</span></div><div><a id="s49F3D658E5DB5BF2A2814AC3464AA468"></a></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:10px;padding-top:10px;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;font-style:normal;font-weight:bold;text-decoration:none;">Item&#160;1A. Risk Factors</span></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:0px;padding-top:10px;text-align:justify;text-indent:30px;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">There have been no material changes from the risk factors previously disclosed in Part I, Item 1A of our Annual Report for the fiscal year ended </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">June&#160;29, 2019</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">, except as noted below.</span></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:10px;padding-top:10px;text-align:justify;text-indent:30px;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">In October 2017 and again in October 2019, we temporarily closed our Santa Rosa, California facility resulting in production stoppage, due to wildfires in the region and the facility&#8217;s close proximity to the wildfire evacuation zone. The location of our production facility could subject us to production delays and/or equipment and property damage.</span></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:10px;padding-top:10px;text-align:justify;text-indent:30px;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">The geographic location of our Northern California headquarters and production facilities subject them to earthquake and wildfire risks. It is impossible to predict the timing, magnitude or location of such natural disasters or their impacts on the local economy and on our operations. If a major earthquake, wildfire or other natural disaster were to damage or destroy our facilities or manufacturing equipment, we may experience potential impacts ranging from production and shipping delays to lost profits and revenues. Moreover, in October 2019, Pacific Gas and Electric (&#8220;PG&amp;E&#8221;), the public electric utility in our Northern California region commenced planned widespread blackouts during the peak wildfire season to avoid and contain wildfires sparked during strong wind events by downed power lines or equipment failure. While we have not experienced damage to our facilities or disruption to operations as a result of these power outages, ongoing blackouts, particularly if prolonged or frequent, could impact our operations going forward.</span></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:0px;padding-top:0px;text-align:justify;text-indent:30px;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">We face risks related to health epidemics and other widespread outbreaks of contagious disease, which could significantly disrupt our operations and impact our operating results.</span></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:0px;padding-top:0px;text-align:justify;text-indent:30px;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;"><br/></span></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:0px;padding-top:0px;text-align:justify;text-indent:30px;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">Significant outbreaks of contagious diseases, and other adverse public health developments, could have a material impact on our business operations and operating results. In December 2019, a strain of novel coronavirus causing respiratory illness emerged in the city of Wuhan in the Hubei province of China. The Chinese government has taken certain emergency measures to combat the spread of the virus, including extension of the Lunar New Year holidays, implementation of travel bans and closure of factories and businesses. We have significant manufacturing facilities and contract manufacturers located in China. While the full impact of this outbreak is unknown at this time, we are closely monitoring the rapid developments in China and continually assessing the potential impact on our business, and have restricted employee travel to Asia and closed facilities in China in response to the emergency measures implemented by the government and as a safety precaution to our employees. Any prolonged disruption of our facilities, suppliers, contract manufacturers or customers could negatively impact our sales and operating results.</span></div><div><a id="s5E63DAABB46057488C4DF97C33951424"></a></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:10px;padding-top:10px;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;font-style:normal;font-weight:bold;text-decoration:none;">Item&#160;2. Unregistered Sales of Equity Securities and Use of Proceeds</span></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:0px;padding-top:0px;text-align:justify;text-indent:30px;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">None.</span></div><div><a id="sBD8D0BF397005CE7A4B1B5CFA430FC94"></a></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:10px;padding-top:10px;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;font-style:normal;font-weight:bold;text-decoration:none;">Item&#160;3. Defaults Upon Senior Securities</span></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:10px;padding-top:10px;text-align:justify;text-indent:30px;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">None.</span></div><div><a id="s4A0B97644CEC57DFB2908877D5A18E4D"></a></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:10px;padding-top:10px;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;font-style:normal;font-weight:bold;text-decoration:none;">Item&#160;4. Mine Safety Disclosures</span></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:10px;padding-top:10px;text-align:justify;text-indent:30px;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">None.</span></div><div><a id="sDEF348A3E79D516690CBD3C1601EE840"></a></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:10px;padding-top:10px;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;font-style:normal;font-weight:bold;text-decoration:none;">Item&#160;5. Other Information</span></div><div><br/></div><div style="text-align:center;"><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:10px;padding-top:10px;text-align:center;text-indent:0px;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">47</span></div></div><hr style="page-break-after:always"></hr><div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:10px;padding-top:10px;text-align:justify;text-indent:30px;font-size:10pt;"><a style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;" href="#sE24B06041F3F5946B625D4BFEFCC01F1"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">Table of Contents</span></a></div></div><div><br/></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:10px;padding-top:10px;text-align:justify;text-indent:30px;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">None.</span></div><div><a id="sD455FFCA66D156EFA12A29DE37686A15"></a></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:10px;padding-top:10px;-sec-extract:summary;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;font-style:normal;font-weight:bold;text-decoration:none;">Item&#160;6. Exhibits</span></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:10px;padding-top:10px;text-align:justify;text-indent:30px;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;">The following documents are filed as Exhibits to this report:</span></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:10px;padding-top:10px;text-align:justify;text-indent:0px;font-size:10pt;"><div
